Introduction

YdBB, also known as Yudabinband, is a five-member South Korean rock band under Faction A Like, a sub-label of MPMG Music. The band was formed by singer-songwriter Yu Dabin with friends she had played music with in college. They performed for the first time in the 12th Money Today University Festival on August 24, 2019, with the song With All My Heart (마음으로). Officially they debuted in 2020, but some of the songs have been performed by Yu Dabin as early as 2018.

The band's lineup consists of Yu Dabin (vocalist), Lee Junhyung (guitar), Cho Youngyun (bass), YOU Myeong Jong (keyboard), and Lee Sangwoon (leader and drums). Yu Dabin has gained critical acclaim as a talented singer-songwriter competing in Mnet’s "Superstar K" as a 18 year-old and making it into the TOP 8 best singers.

The focus of YdBB's music is reaching out to the deepest memories and feelings of every listener. Based on Yu Dabin's poetic songwriting and members' outstanding music skills, the band plays a wide range of genres from acoustic folk to rock. They are notable for winning the Grand Prize in the "2020 ALL STAR Music Festival" and emerging as one of the TOP 13 bands in a prestigious band competition "INDIESTANCE." They released the song “WHY”, their debut song, on the "Indiestance 2020 Compilation" album on November 19, 2020.

Their first single "LETTER" was released on March 9, 2021, and the title track was their first music video. Their first full album was released on October 29, 2021, titled "YUDABINBAND 1st" and it included the songs they released in their first 4 singles and 4 additional songs, one of those the title track With All My Heart (마음으로), which was their 1st performance as a band in 2019. Recently, YdBB competed on Mnet's band survival program "Great Seoul Invasion" where they came third, capturing viewers with their emotional performances. In 2022, they also added OSTs for such dramas as "Cheer Up" (SBS), and "Missing: The Other Side 2" (tvN) to their discography.
